required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2 Healthy Volunteer Study to Evaluate the Ability of PRT064445 to Reverse the Effects of Several Blood Thinner Drugs on Laboratory Tests (Module 2 of 4)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Vehicle-Controlled Multiple Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Intravenously Administered PRT064445 After Dosing to Steady State With One of Four Direct/Indirect fXa Inhibitors in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the ability of PRT064445 to reverse the effects of several blood thinner drugs on laboratory tests. The study also is evaluating the blood levels of PRT064445 given at different doses.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, double-blind, vehicle-controlled study to assess the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK), and pharmacodynamics (PD) of intravenously administered PRT064445 after dosing to steady state with one of four direct/indirect factor Xa (fXa) inhibitors in healthy volunteers.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study has four modules with a total of 21 cohorts, each module was reported and submitted separately. Module 1, NCT01758432 (54 subjects with 7 cohorts including placebo); Module 2, NCT03578146 (48 subjects with 6 cohorts including placebo); Module 3, NCT03551730 (27 subjects with 4 cohorts including placebo); Module 4, NCT03551743 (28 subjects with 4 cohorts including placebo)
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Anti-fXa Activity at 2 Mins Following Andexanet/Placebo Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 2 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo administration
primary_outcome.description: Anti-fXa activity was measured immediately prior to (Baseline) and at 2 mins following andexanet/placebo administration. Anti-fXa activity was measured using a commercial kit (Coamatic Heparin-82 33 9363, DiaPharma)

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Thrombin Generation at 2 Mins Following Andexanet/Placebo Administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 2 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo administration
secondary_outcome.description: Thrombin generation was measured immediately prior to (Baseline) and at 2 mins following andexanet/placebo administration. Thrombin generation was measured using a TF-initiated thrombin generation assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Unbound Rivaroaxaban Plasma Concentration at 2 Mins Following Andexanet/Placebo Administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 2 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo administration
secondary_outcome.description: Unbound rivaroxaban concentrations was measured immediately prior to (Baseline) and at 2 mins following andexanet/placebo administration. Unbound plasma concentrations for rivaroxaban were determined by a rapid equilibrium dialysis method followed by Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectometry assay.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood was collected at predose, 0.033, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5 and 14.5 hours postdose.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Andexanet Area Under the Drug Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 Extrapolated to Infinity (AUC0-inf )
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood was collected at predose, 0.033, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5 and 14.5 hours postdose.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay. AUC0-inf was calculated using a non-compartmental approach

secondary_outcome.measure: Andexanet Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood was collected at predose, 0.033, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5 and 14.5 hours postdose.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay. Tmax was taken directly from the raw data.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood was collected at predose, 0.033, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5 and 14.5 hours postdose.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay. t1/2 was determined by linear regression of the log concentration on the terminal portion of the plasma concentration-time curve.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood was collected at predose, 0.033, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5 and 14.5 hours postdose.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay. CL was calculated using a non-compartmental approach, calculated as Dose/AUC0-inf

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood was collected at predose, 0.033, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5 and 14.5 hours postdose.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay. Vss was calculated using a non-compartmental approach.

arm_group.description: 210 mg andexanet IV bolus administered over 7 minutes (~30 mg/min)
420 mg andexanet IV bolus administered over 14 minutes (~30 mg/min)
600 mg andexanet IV bolus administered over 20 minutes (~30 mg/min)
720 mg IV bolus administered over 24 minutes [~30 mg/min] followed by 240 mg continuous IV infusion [4 mg/min over 60 min)
800 mg IV bolus administered over 26.7 minutes [~30 mg/min] followed by 960 mg continuous IV infusion [8 mg/min over 120 min]
Placebo administered intravenously (IV) as a bolus or a bolus followed by continuous fusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy men or women between the ages of 18 and 45 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- History (including family history) or symptoms of, or risk factors for bleeding
- History (including family history) of or risk factors for a hypercoagulable or thrombotic condition
- Absolute/relative contraindication to anticoagulation or treatment with specific anticoagulants
- History of major surgery, severe trauma or bone fracture within 3 months prior to dosing; or planned surgery within 1 month after dosing.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subject recruitment occurred at investigative site in the US between March 2013 through April 2014
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Rivaroxaban was administered orally at 20 mg once daily for 6 days to steady-state in an open label fashion. Subjects were then randomized to receive study treatment (andexanet or placebo) intravenously at different doses/dose regimens on Day 6, all bolus doses administered such that they ended at 3 hours after the last dose of rivaroxaban.

group.title: Module 2 Placebo
group.description: Placebo administered intravenously (IV) as a bolus or a bolus followed by continuous infusion

group.title: Module 2 (210 mg)
group.description: 210 mg andexanet IV bolus administered over 7 minutes (~30 mg/min)

group.title: Module 2 (420 mg)
group.description: 420 mg andexanet IV bolus administered over 14 minutes (~30 mg/min)

group.title: Module 2 (600 mg)
group.description: 600 mg andexanet IV bolus administered over 20 minutes (~30 mg/min)

group.title: Module 2 (720 mg Bolus + 240 mg Infusion)
group.description: 720 mg IV bolus administered over 24 minutes [~30 mg/min] followed by 240 mg continuous IV infusion [4 mg/min over 60 min)

group.title: Module 2 (800 mg Bolus + 960 mg Infusion)
group.description: 800 mg IV bolus administered over 26.7 minutes [~30 mg/min] followed by 960 mg continuous IV infusion [8 mg/min over 120 min]

baseline.population: 48 subjects were enrolled in this study. Three subjects received rivaroxaban but were discontinued prior to receiving andexanet/placebo due to problems with the infusion pumps observed in prior subjects in the cohort and these subjects were replaced.

outcome.title: Efficacy: Percent Change From Baseline in Anti-fXa Activity at 2 Mins Following Andexanet/Placebo Administration
outcome.description: Anti-fXa activity was measured immediately prior to (Baseline) and at 2 mins following andexanet/placebo administration. Anti-fXa activity was measured using a commercial kit (Coamatic Heparin-82 33 9363, DiaPharma)
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 2 minutes following the end of andexanet/placebo administration
outcome.population: 45 subjects who received andexanet or placebo were included in the pharmacodynamics (PD) analysis

outcome.title: Andexanet Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay.
outcome.time_frame: Blood was collected at predose, 0.033, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5 and 14.5 hours postdose.
outcome.population: 30 subjects who received andexanet were included in the andexanet PK analysis

outcome.title: Andexanet Apparent Terminal Elimination Half-life (t1/2)
outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay. t1/2 was determined by linear regression of the log concentration on the terminal portion of the plasma concentration-time curve.
outcome.time_frame: Blood was collected at predose, 0.033, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5 and 14.5 hours postdose.
outcome.population: 30 subjects who received andexanet were included in the andexanet PK analysis

measure.title: Andexanet Apparent Terminal Elimination Half-life (t1/2)
measure.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay. t1/2 was determined by linear regression of the log concentration on the terminal portion of the plasma concentration-time curve.
measure.population: 30 subjects who received andexanet were included in the andexanet PK analysis

outcome.title: Andexanet Total Systemic Clearance (CL)
outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of andexanet was determined using a validated method that involved analysis of citrated human plasma by an electrochemiluminescent assay. CL was calculated using a non-compartmental approach, calculated as Dose/AUC0-inf
outcome.time_frame: Blood was collected at predose, 0.033, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5 and 14.5 hours postdose.
outcome.population: 30 subjects who received andexanet were included in the andexanet PK analysis

reported_events.desc: Only subjects who received at least one dose of study drug were included in the safety analysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Conducted in healthy volunteers at Clinical Research Organization.
